definition: so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
to forget/to overlook/to neglect
to appear/to look/form/shape

sentences.english: He felt carried away as long as hearing some flattering words.
sentences.chinese: 他只要听到几句恭维话就会得意忘形。

sentences.english: We were carried away when we won the game.
sentences.chinese: 当我们赢得了比赛，我们高兴的得意忘形。

sentences.english: Maie seems to be quite above herself these days. What happened?
sentences.chinese: 麦琪这几天得意忘形，怎么啦？

sentences.english: Maggie seems to be quite above herself these days. What happened?
sentences.chinese: 麦琪这几天得意忘形，怎么啦？

sentences.english: he will forget himself as long as he hears flattering words.
sentences.chinese: 他只要听到几句恭维话就会得意忘形。

sentences.english: He just heard a few compliments will get carried away.
sentences.chinese: 他只要听到几句恭维话就会得意忘形。

sentences.english: His head is easily turned by even a small achievement.
sentences.chinese: 他这个人有了一点成绩就得意忘形。

sentences.english: He will go beyond himself  as long as someone flatters him.
sentences.chinese: 他只要听到几句恭维话就会得意忘形。

sentences.english: He will be on cloud nine when he gets some complimentary words.
sentences.chinese: 他只要听到几句恭维话就会得意忘形。

sentences.english: The great success has bloated her ego to an alarming degree.
sentences.chinese: 巨大成功使她得意忘形到惊人的地步。

sentences.english: These are early days, so don't get carried away.
sentences.chinese: 然而说这些还是为时过早，因此不要得意忘形。

sentences.english: It probably shouldn't get too comfortable with the title.
sentences.chinese: 不过，香港对这个头衔也不能得意忘形。

sentences.english: Lao Wan feels very comfortable and tread on air.
sentences.chinese: 老万感到舒服极了，有些得意忘形。

sentences.english: Jack's election to the presidency of our union has turned his head.
sentences.chinese: 杰克当选为我们的工会主席，这事使他得意忘形起来。

sentences.english: Proud in my Ibiza memories, I kicked the Honda alive.
sentences.chinese: 在伊比沙岛的回忆中得意忘形，我发动了本田摩托车。

definition: to get carried away/to forget oneself
complacent/self-satisfied
fully content with one's achievements (idiom)/complacent
immeasurably self-satisfied
to think highly of oneself
immensely pleased with oneself (idiom)/proud/complacent
proud of oneself/pleased with oneself/complacent
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
immensely pleased with oneself (idiom)/proud/complacent
to underestimate the enemy
elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
arrogant and conceited
to forget one's manners/to forget oneself/to lose self-control (in a situation)
lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant
satisfied with one's accomplishment and arrogant as a result (idiom); resting on one's laurels and despising others
